job description:
We are seeking a flexible, detail oriented and innovative Scientist to join the Analytical Development & Quality Control (AD&QC) team. The successful candidate will work within the internal AD&QC team to develop analytical methodologies for extensive characterization of SQZ Biotechnologys cell therapy products. The candidate will also effectively and routinely collaborate with colleagues from Research and Development teams.

At SQZ, we're proud of our culture and always look to grow our team with people who share our values. We:
  • Squeeze Together: We value teamwork, trust, and transparency as critical components for achieving our mission and exceeding our goals
  • Question Boundaries: Were committed to questioning the status quo and changing the world through our people and our science
  • Zap Obstacles: We strive to be pioneers. Were resilient when it comes to navigating challenges, anticipated or not, scientific and otherwise
Primary responsibilities:
  • Develop analytical methods for heightened characterization of starting materials used in cell therapy products that include assessing purity, content and physicochemical attributes of the starting materials
  • Develop a matrix of analytical methods to measure antigen delivery in cell therapy products
  • Develop analytical methods to measure purity, dose, and potency of cell therapy products
  • Provide analytical support for understanding the mechanism of action of cell therapy products
  • Develop methods to measure trace analytes and process residuals
  • Conduct pilot studies to understand stability profile of starting materials and cell therapy products
  • Provide testing support for Research and Development teams as needed
Candidate must:
  • Work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Design and troubleshoot experiments
  • Critically analyze and present data
  • Manage and mentor junior team members as needed
  • Demonstrate critical thinking, problem-solving and attention to detail

Minimum Qualifications:
  • Ph.D. in scientific field with at least 2 years of Analytical Development experience in industry
  • Expertise in cell handling and aseptic techniques
  • Experience with analytical, molecular biology and immunological methods (U/HPLC, LCMS, plate readers, UV, Fluorescence, qPCR, Sanger sequencing, gel electrophoresis, western blot, ELISA, Flow cytometry)
  • Excellent computer skills including using fluency with Excel, Minitab, GraphPad Prism or similar statistical and data analysis software
  • Experience writing scientific reports
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience authoring characterization data to support CMC content for regulatory submissions
  • Experience with data processing software like ChemStation, Chromeleon, FlowJo etc.
